summary: This bill, the "Working Waterfront Disaster Mitigation Tax Credit Act," amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit for hazard mitigation projects on working waterfront property. The credit is 30% of qualified investments, capped at $300,000 (with inflation adjustments). Eligible projects must meet specific building code standards and include measures like structural elevation, flood risk reduction, shoreline stabilization, and retrofitting. The bill defines qualifying property and establishes gross receipts tests. It also includes provisions for payments to U.S. possessions and sets an effective date.
